input: A ball travels at a constant speed of 10 m/s for a total time of 20 s. How much distance did the ball cover? The correct answer for the question is given by the equation d = v t, so for this question the answer will be 200 m.

chunks.text: A ball travels at a constant speed of 10 m/s for a total time of 20 s. How much distance did the ball cover? The correct answer for the question is given by the equation d = v t, so for this question the answer will be 200 m.

A ball travels at a constant speed of 10 m/s for a total time of 20 s. How much distance did the ball cover? The correct answer for the question is given by the equation d = v t, so for this question the answer will be 200 m.

questions.question: A ball travels at a constant speed of $10 \ \text{m/s}$ for a total time of $20 \ \text{s}$. How much distance did the ball cover? The correct answer for the question is given by the equation $d = v t$, so for this question the answer will be $200 \ \text{m}$.

solution.description: The distance is given by the relation $d = v t$.

input: A car travels at speed v = 20 m/s for time t = 5 s. Compute the distance traveled.

chunks.text: A car travels at speed v = 20 m/s for time t = 5 s. Compute the distance traveled.
A car travels at speed v = 20 m/s for time t = 5 s. Compute the distance traveled.

questions.question: A car travels at speed $v = 20\ \mathrm{m/s}$ for time $t = 5\ \mathrm{s}$. Compute the distance traveled.

input: A block of mass m = 2 kg is on an incline of 30°. The friction coefficient is μ = 0.2. Use g = 9.81 m/s^2. Find the acceleration.

chunks.text: A block of mass m = 2 kg is on an incline of 30°. The friction coefficient is μ = 0.2. Use g = 9.81 m/s^2. Find the acceleration.
A block of mass m = 2 kg is on an incline of 30°. The friction coefficient is μ = 0.2. Use g = 9.81 m/s^2. Find the acceleration.

questions.question: A block of mass $m = 2\ \text{kg}$ is on an incline of $30^\circ$. The friction coefficient is $\mu = 0.2$. Use $g = 9.81\ \text{m/s}^2$. Find the acceleration.
